classification: HSCA Administrative Folder, LEE HARVEY OSWALD
document_type: Memorandum, Letter, Notes, Press Releases, Testimony, News Articles, Translation
security: This document contains information about a closed-circuit television system used for surveillance, which, if revealed, could compromise intelligence-gathering methods. Additionally, it mentions a threat against the 'Johnson gang,' disseminated to the White House and Secret Service, potentially endangering individuals. Quoting: 'Each of you who continues to partake in the actions of the Johnson gang...will shortly pay with their lives.'
summary: This document includes an FBI memo regarding a closed-circuit television system installation for surveillance and a CIA advisory about a letter containing threats against the 'Johnson gang,' which was disseminated to the White House and Secret Service.
summary_one_paragraph: This FBI file from December 28, 1966, contains a collection of administrative documents including a memo, letters, notes, press releases, testimony, news articles, and translations related to the HSCA administrative folder and Lee Harvey Oswald. The file includes information regarding the installation of a closed-circuit television system for surveillance purposes, as well as a CIA advisory concerning a letter received by the Swiss Federal Police from Joachim Joesten containing threats against the 'Johnson gang,' which was subsequently disseminated to the White House and Secret Service.
title: HSCA ADMINISTRATIVE FOLDER, LEE HARVEY OSWALD VOLUME XII
